title: Drawing, "Textile Design:  Montezuma", designed 1910–12
medium: Brush and gouache, black ink, graphite on paper
markings: Stamp:  lower right corner of mount:  WIENER/ WERKSTÄTTE in red
inscribed: Inscribed in black ink lower center of mount:  DESSIN:  MONTE - ZVMA; top right corner:
dimensions:
2 1/2 x 8 1/8 inches (6.4 x 20.6 cm)
12 1/2 x 17 3/4 inches (31.8 x 45.1 cm); complete sheet
creditline: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds
description: The "Montezuma" design consists of rhythmic geometric shapes in the form of alternating curving bands and plant vine in black.  The negative space is filled with color, blue in this design.

exhibitions.title: Glass of the Avant-Garde: From Vienna Secession to Bauhaus

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Textile Design:  Montezuma", designed 1910–12.
designed 1910–12. Brush and gouache, black ink, graphite on paper. Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds. 1988-62-206.
